stream_context.summary: Kaze works on the new retro-futuristic moon-base level (formerly a slide, now Course 15) while celebrating public release of Demo 2 (only Course 1). Most of the stream is live design iteration on platform layout, trampolines, and a still-undecided boss concept. He also troubleshoots hardware compatibility and chats about philosophy, color theory, and community feedback.

development_findings.summary: Public Demo 2 was released earlier the same day, containing only Course 1; a full play-through video will be uploaded tomorrow.
development_findings.quote: I released the second demo today… Keep in mind the demo is just course one.

development_findings.summary: Course 15 has been completely redesigned from its original ‘slide’ concept into a 1960s retro-futuristic space colony with monorails, satellites, and a climbable rocket.
development_findings.quote: This level has changed a lot since stream last saw it… the theme for this is like retrofuturism, so we want this to look like a space colony as imagined in 1960.

development_findings.summary: He brainstormed multiple boss ideas for Course 15: 1) a Blob with a visible brain you kick, 2) Sluggy the Unshaven from Yoshi’s Island, 3) a giant space squid that attacks via tentacles emerging from glowing rifts; no final decision yet.
development_findings.quote: Alright, fuck it. Instead of the blob, it's Sluggy the Unshaven… Later: What if black holes with tentacles coming out of it all over the level attack Mario?

development_findings.summary: Platforming aid under development: trampoline-like pads that launch Mario; current mesh and visual feedback feel unintuitive and may be replaced by spherical bouncer assets.
development_findings.quote: This is going to be so shocking when you land on it… Maybe we can use the bouncer platforms we already have.

development_findings.summary: Movement rebalance: Spin/ground-pound-dive can be performed anytime but now cancels momentum to function as a recovery move and prevent abuse.
development_findings.quote: I'm gonna remove all momentum because it's supposed to be like a safety move… You're not supposed to be using it all over the place.

development_findings.summary: Optimization experiment: attempted to execute code directly from cartridge to free RAM bus; saved 2 ms CPU but gave no RDP gain; investigating why.
development_findings.quote: My idea was we run the code directly from the cartridge… Unfortunately it did not and I don't know why.

development_findings.summary: Hardware bug: game fails to boot on EverDrive X7 because the flashcart doesn’t clear data cache; Kaze is testing a build that invalidates all RAM on startup.
development_findings.quote: I found out today that my game does not boot on the EverDrive X7… so I’m trying a build where I invalidate the entire RAM before I boot the game.

development_findings.summary: Speed gains from optimization are reinvested into higher-polygon scenery, especially in dense areas like the new space colony hub.
development_findings.quote: Speed gains are mostly spent on like more polygons and details, for example this area here.

development_findings.summary: He prefers implicit environmental storytelling over overt exposition such as lecture-style library texts.
development_findings.quote: I don't think that explaining the lore of the library is a very smooth way of doing it. If anything, we would want implicit storytelling.

context_findings.summary: Kaze rejects traditional color theory, calling it ‘bullshit’.
context_findings.quote: I don't like color theory. I don't think color theory is real.

context_findings.summary: He dislikes superficial greetings (‘How are you?’) and muses about Kant’s categorical imperative to rationalize not using them.
context_findings.quote: No one should ever ask me how you are… but it's considered polite… so according to Kant, should I ask people how they are or should I not?

context_findings.summary: Shows concern about potential YouTube copyright strikes affecting collaborators’ monetization (e.g., SimpleFlips).
context_findings.quote: Even if it's up on YouTube, that doesn't mean it's not struck… You can't monetize it and that would ruin the VOD for SimpleFlips.

context_findings.summary: Expresses surprise and appreciation for high community interest in the demo and positive feedback on camera feel.
context_findings.quote: I'm surprised how many people wanted to play the demo… people were like, oh the camera took a bit to get used to but then I loved it.

context_findings.summary: Shares personal quirk: hates coffee (‘tastes like ass’) and started watching more anime on recommendation of a viewer.

biobak.summary: Discusses providing better textures for the trampoline platform; Kaze trusts Biobak to improve current placeholder.
biobak.quote: I'm sure Biobak can find a better texture for what I'm trying to convey in here.

biobak.summary: Joins philosophical banter about Kant and social etiquette.

key_stories.title: Demo 2 Release Day
key_stories.summary: Kaze drops the second public demo (Course 1 only) and monitors live feedback during the stream.
key_stories.challenge: Ensuring the demo feels polished despite limited scope and anticipating community reactions.
key_stories.process: Uploaded patch, announced on stream, plans to post full play-through video next day.
key_stories.outcome: Positive reception; viewers praise movement and camera; Kaze notes complaints about noisy audio to fix.
key_stories.key_quote: Looks like people somewhat like it… I want to reduce the overall noisiness because a lot of people complained.

key_stories.title: Boss Concept Ping-Pong
key_stories.summary: Course 15 boss pivots from Blob to Sluggy to Space Squid within one brainstorming session.
key_stories.challenge: Finding a 1960s sci-fi–inspired enemy that fits mechanics and thematic goals.
key_stories.process: Chat proposes ideas; Kaze evaluates mechanics (platforming vs waiting, damage cues) and visual storytelling.
key_stories.outcome: No final pick; Space Squid with tentacle rifts currently leading but unresolved.
key_stories.key_quote: What if black holes with tentacles coming out of it all over the level attacking Mario?

key_stories.title: EverDrive Boot Failure
key_stories.summary: Game crashes on EverDrive X7 hardware due to uncleared cache.
key_stories.challenge: Need physical cartridge compatibility for eventual release.
key_stories.process: Identified issue, wrote test build that invalidates RAM and left it running for over an hour.
key_stories.key_quote: Right now I'm trying a build where I invalidate the entire RAM before I boot the game.
